column4: I'm upgrading to Karmic; in the process, it gave me a list of packages that are no longer supported. Some of these, like gcc 4.3, I'm guessing are due to newer versions' availability. Is that the case for all of them? Or is Canonical dropping support for major functionality?
they're just all packages you no longer need.
they're stuff that 'apt-get autoremove' would remove if you ran it
no.  if you're using bittorrent, you'll be downloading the whole ISO
you could use the update-manager to upgrade your existing install, but it won't use bittorrent to do so
are they going to support this at some point? It wants to download 1.6 GB of packages and the Ubuntu servers are soooo sloooow.
go to 'software sources' and tell if to pick the 'best server'.  it'll find a non-ubuntu one that's faster.
or just wait 24h and the ubuntu servers will be faster again
thanks for the tip about "best server", that should help
that server may be a little behind the *.ubuntu.com ones, but it's worth it for the extra speed
there are many different DE's out there
I know, but which is fastest?
go with something like openbox or something like that
it's not completely barebones, it has the minimum features you expect without bloat
